name: select
origin: **Isolate single microspores from a single tetrad**1) In the field, select plants presenting tetrad-stage pollen, and harvest the top ~30 cm part containing tassels into a flask filled with water._Note 1_: Under these conditions, the immature pollens would keep developing, so that fresh tetrad-stage cells can be provides from upper to lower spikelets continuously at intervals of ~30min.2) In a spikelet there are three older and three younger anthers

name: harvest
object: the top ~30 cm part containing tassels
origin: **Isolate single microspores from a single tetrad**1) In the field, select plants presenting tetrad-stage pollen, and harvest the top ~30 cm part containing tassels into a flask filled with water._Note 1_: Under these conditions, the immature pollens would keep developing, so that fresh tetrad-stage cells can be provides from upper to lower spikelets continuously at intervals of ~30min.2) In a spikelet there are three older and three younger anthers

name: incubate
notice: immature pollens would keep developing, so that fresh tetrad-stage cells can be provides from upper to lower spikelets continuously at intervals of ~30min.

name: isolate

name: transfer
origin: Release cells from the three same-stage anthers into Isolation Buffer on a slide

name: add
origin: From step 2) to step 5), cells should be kept in the Isolation Buffer.3) Isolate a single tetrad into a new drop of Isolation Buffer using a thin glass pipette._Note 3_: Use a thin glass pipette system and Programmable Microinjector PM 2000 \(MDI, South Plainfield, USA) to isolate single tetrads \(step 3)) and single microspores \(step 5)), and to destroy the cell wall \(step 4)), under 4×microscopy.4) Repeated aspiration in and out was used to destroy the cell walls and disrupt the tetrads

name: transfer
device: thin glass pipette system and Programmable Microinjector PM 2000 (MDI, South Plainfield, USA)

name: transfer
destination: PCR wells filled with 4μl PBS(QIAGEN, Hilden, Germany)
origin: Then, four microspores can be separated without cell wall.5) One by one, place cells in less than 0.5μl Isolation Buffer into PCR wells filled with 4μl PBS \(QIAGEN, Hilden, Germany)

name: keep
origin: The PCR wells should be kept on ice._Note 4_: When aspirating a microspore in the glass pipette, make sure it is still visible under the microscope

name: check
notice: make sure it is still visible
origin: The PCR wells should be kept on ice._Note 4_: When aspirating a microspore in the glass pipette, make sure it is still visible under the microscope

name: transfer
origin: After blowing it to a PCR well, the cell should not be seen in the pipette any more, to ensure that the cell is now in the PCR well for the next reaction.**Lysis of cells**6) Add 3μl lysis Buffer \(DLB : DTT = 11 : 1) into the PCR well containing a cell sample

name: add
origin: After blowing it to a PCR well, the cell should not be seen in the pipette any more, to ensure that the cell is now in the PCR well for the next reaction.**Lysis of cells**6) Add 3μl lysis Buffer \(DLB : DTT = 11 : 1) into the PCR well containing a cell sample

name: dilute
origin: These precautions avoid reducing the Integrity of DNA._Note 8_: MDA products are suitable for Single Nucleotide Variants \(SNV) analysis, but not appropriate for quantification analysis \(Copy Number Variations, CNV).**Quality control of whole-genome amplification products**:8) Dilute the amplification product 1:50

name: transfer
origin: Use the 10 markers \(Table 1) to amplify the diluted DNA by PCR.The PCR mixture contains 1ul diluted DNA, 1ul forward primer \(5mM), 1μl reverse primer \(5mM), 1.5μl 10×PCR Buffer \(Takara), 0.3μl dNTP \(10mM), 0.15μl rTaq \(Katara), 10.05μl d2H2O

name: incubate

origin: Use the 10 markers \(Table 1) to amplify the diluted DNA by PCR.The PCR mixture contains 1ul diluted DNA, 1ul forward primer \(5mM), 1μl reverse primer \(5mM), 1.5μl 10×PCR Buffer \(Takara), 0.3μl dNTP \(10mM), 0.15μl rTaq \(Katara), 10.05μl d2H2O

name: incubate
origin: Perform PCR with the following cycling parameters:Process Temperature Duration Cycles see Table 2.Detect the PCR product by 2% Agarose gel electrophoresis

name: detect

name: transfer
origin: Sample with no less than 8 of the 10 markers successfully amplified, is considered to be of a quality sufficient to make a library.**Measuring DNA concentration of amplification product**9) Add 4μl amplification product into 100μl d2H2O

name: calculate
origin: The concentration should be approximately 40~50 ng/μl.**DNA Library construction**10) Dilute DNA to 1.2μg in 60μl

name: dilute
origin: The concentration should be approximately 40~50 ng/μl.**DNA Library construction**10) Dilute DNA to 1.2μg in 60μl

name: transfer
origin: Then fragment it by sonication \(Bioruptor UCD-200, Seraing, Belgium) at ~5℃for a few cycles \(30s sonication and 30s rest per one cycle), so that most of the DNA fragments range from 300bp to 500bp._Note 9_: Detection of fragments’ size is by 2% Agarose gel electrophoresis; if most of the fragment are still larger than 500bp, continue sonicating a few more cycles until the suitable size of fragments are generated

name: incubate
thermo_program: 30s sonication and 30s rest per one cycle, repeated for a few cycles
